meanings.definition: The process of oxidation caused by light.
meanings.sent1: Photooxidation can occur when light interacts with certain chemicals.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study photooxidation to understand how light can change the properties of materials.
meanings.sent3: The photooxidation of the paint on the car made it change color in the sun.
meanings.sent4: The photooxidation of the metal gate under the intense sunlight gave it a rusty appearance.
meanings.sent5: The photooxidation of the plastic bottle left outside made it brittle and easily breakable.

meanings.definition: The act of oxidizing a substance through exposure to light.
meanings.sent1: Excessive photooxidation can degrade the quality of certain materials over time.
meanings.sent2: Photographers need to be aware of the potential photooxidation of their film in bright sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The accidental photooxidation of the food left on the kitchen counter made it spoil faster.
meanings.sent4: The photooxidation of the fabric caused by the sun's rays weakened its fibers.
meanings.sent5: The photooxidation of the paper left near the window made it turn yellow and brittle.
